description: From French commencement; analyzable as commence +â€Ž -ment.

entries.meaning: The first existence of anything; act or fact of commencing; the beginning.
examples: The time of Henry VII nearly coincides with the commencement of what is termed modern history.

entries.meaning: The day when degrees are conferred by colleges and universities upon students and others.
A graduation ceremony, from a school, college or university.
